revised_title: Advances in Calorimetry for Measuring Heats of Mixing
tldr: The authors designed a calorimeter to measure the heats of mixing in binary liquid systems, eliminating the need for corrections due to changes in the vapor phase composition. They tested the calorimeter on several systems, disproving the claim that one system is ideal. This work improved the accuracy of heat mixing measurements and provided a better understanding of molecular interactions in liquids.
